item.title: Kate add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kate add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Kate add a quote by Eduardo Galeano
item.description: "The Church says: the body is a sin. Science says: the body is a machine. Advertising says: The body is a business. The Body says: I am a fiesta." -- Eduardo Galeano

item.title: Kate add a quote by Veronique Vienne
item.description: "In America, we believe that our happiness depends on getting breaks, even though being American is already the biggest break we will ever get." -- Veronique Vienne

item.title: Kate add a quote by B. R. Myers
item.description: "People who cannot distinguish between good and bad language, or who regard the distinction as unimportant, are unlikely to think carefully about anything else." -- B. R. Myers

item.title: Kate add a quote by Anne Bronte
item.description: "But he who dares not grasp the thorn Should never crave the rose." -- Anne Bronte

item.title: Kate add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "With school turning out more runners, jumpers, racers, tinkerers, grabbers, snatchers, fliers, and swimmers instead of examiners, critics, knowers, and imaginative creators, the word 'intellectual,' of course, became the swear word it deserved to be." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Kate add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "Men can starve from a lack of self-realization as much as they can from a lack of bread." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Kate add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Once you learn to read, you will be forever free." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Kate add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Kate add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Kate add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Kate add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kate add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Kate add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kate add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Kate add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Kate add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Weeds are flowers, too, once you get to know them." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Kate add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "The one thing that unites all human beings, regardless of age, gender, religion, economic status, or ethnic background, is that, deep down inside, we all believe that we are above-average drivers." -- Dave Barry

item.title: Kate add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: Kate add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "Think before you speak. Read before you think." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Kate add a quote by Samuel Lover
item.description: "Circumstances are the rulers of the weak; they are but the instruments of the wise." -- Samuel Lover

item.title: Kate add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "My heart is warm with the friends I make, And better friends I'll not be knowing, Yet there isn't a train I wouldn't take, No matter where it's going." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Kate add a quote by Ishmael Reed
item.description: "No one says a novel has to be one thing. It can be anything it wants to be, a vaudeville show, the six o’clock news, the mumblings of wild men saddled by demons." -- Ishmael Reed

item.title: Kate add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "To his dog, every man is Napoleon; hence the constant popularity of dogs." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Kate add a quote by Rebecca West
item.description: "I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat, or a prostitute." -- Rebecca West

item.title: Kate add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "Everybody else is working to change, persuade, tempt and control them. The best readers come to fiction to be free of all that noise." -- Philip Roth

item.title: Kate add a quote by Lawrence Durrell
item.description: "Does not everything depend on our interpretation of the silence around us?" -- Lawrence Durrell

item.title: Kate add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Kate add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit." -- Elbert Hubbard
